intro: Brassica chinensis f. youngtungtsai, commonly known as the youngtungtsai mustard, is a cultivated variant of the Chinese mustard plant. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and thick, fleshy leaves that are often used in traditional Chinese cuisine. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces small yellow flowers in the spring. Its leaves are rich in nutrients and have a distinctive spicy flavor due to the presence of glucosinolates. This variety is well-suited for both ornamental and culinary purposes in temperate climates.
